dr_chen.name: Dr. Tran
always_reveal: We are overwhelmed. I need you to triage these cases.
My staff have listed the recent admissions below.
Most have high fever and altered mental status.
Initial lab work shows Leukocytosis (high WBC), which suggests infection, not poisoning.

parent_tamu.name: Panya's Mother
parent_tamu.personality: Confused and defensive. Proud of her safe village.
always_reveal: I don't understand! Tamu is safe. We live in the hills!
We don't have pigs! We don't have dirty water!
Panya was healthy... until we came back from the market trip.

conditional_clues.market: We went down to the Nalu market to sell our forest mushrooms. We meant to come back the same day!
conditional_clues.travel: The district bus broke down. We had to sleep on my cousin's porch... right next to that noisy pig co-op.
conditional_clues.nalu: Yes, we visited Nalu recently. But we live in Tamu!
conditional_clues.bus: The bus broke down! We were stuck overnight. Panya slept on the porch near the pigs.

red_herrings: Maybe the bad air from the lowlands followed us home.

parent_general.name: Worried Parent
always_reveal: The fever came so fast. Hot like fire.
Yes, we live near the rice fields.
We have a few pigs, like everyone else.
The mosquitoes are terrible this year.

conditional_clues.pesticide: I don't know about poison. I only know my child is burning up.
conditional_clues.travel: We haven't gone anywhere. We stay in the village.

nurse_joy.name: Nurse Mai
nurse_joy.personality: Exhausted, overwhelmed. Kind but disorganized. Gives too much detail.
always_reveal: Children arrived in clusters on June 3, 6, 7, 9
Symptoms: sudden high fever, headache, then confusion/seizures
No rash observed in any cases
Parents mentioned many mosquitoes at dusk
She treated many cuts and bruises from farmers, but these kids are different

conditional_clues.pigs: Some parents said their pigs were 'screaming' at night before the kids got sick.
conditional_clues.vaccine: We ran out of Japanese Encephalitis vaccines 18 months ago.
conditional_clues.pesticide: Farmers use stronger stuff now for the rice bugs, but poisoning usually causes vomiting and drooling, not just fever.

red_herrings: Thinks maybe bad drinking water is causing illness
Mentions a rumor about spirits in the forest

nurse_kabwe.name: Nurse Esi
nurse_kabwe.personality: Chatty, relaxed. Knows everyone in Kabwe. Not very worried yet.
always_reveal: Kabwe is usually very healthy. Just mild fevers recently.
I sent two children to Nalu/Hospital because they wouldn't wake up.
Most people here are farmers - rice and maize.
We have many goats and chickens here, fewer pigs than Nalu.

conditional_clues.path: The kids walk to Nalu for school. It's a long walk through the rice paddies.
conditional_clues.school: The kids walk to Nalu for school. It's a long walk through the rice paddies.
conditional_clues.pigs: We don't have big pig farms here. Just a few household pigs.
conditional_clues.water: Our well water is good. Deep boreholes.

red_herrings: Thinking it might be just a bad flu season.

chv_tamu.name: Volunteer Sarah
chv_tamu.personality: Eager to help. Very proud of her village's health record.
always_reveal: Tamu is safe! We live high up, away from the bad air.
I have my record book here. Mostly cuts, scrapes, and coughs.
We raise goats and chickens. Very few pigs here.
Only one child got very sick recently - Little Panya, she's 7 years old.

conditional_clues.panya: Little Panya got sick with the 'sleeping fever'. Her family went to Nalu market to sell mushrooms two weeks ago.
conditional_clues.travel: Panya's family went to Nalu to sell forest mushrooms. The bus broke down and they had to stay overnight.
conditional_clues.nalu: Panya was in Nalu two weeks ago. They slept near the pig co-op when the bus broke down.
conditional_clues.market: The family sells mushrooms at the Nalu market. They go down there sometimes.
conditional_clues.mosquitoes: Not many mosquitoes up here in the hills. Too dry.

red_herrings: Believes the mountain air protects them from all diseases.

foreman_rex.name: Foreman Prasert
always_reveal: It's not my mine! It's those farmers and their illegal chemicals!
I saw them using 'Dragon Fire' pesticide. It's banned!
That stuff melts your brain. That's why the kids are seizing!
My water is clean. I tested it myself.
red_herrings: It is definitely the Dragon Fire poison causing seizures.

vet_amina.name: Vet Supatra
vet_amina.personality: Cautious scientist. Requires data before speaking.
always_reveal: I am monitoring the livestock. We have pigs, buffalo, and goats.
The buffalo are healthy. They are working hard in the rice paddies.
I have seen some issues in the pig farms, but I am still investigating.

conditional_clues.abortion: Yes, some sows are having stillbirths. That is worrying.
conditional_clues.je: It is... possible. But I need to see your human data first. Does it match pig density?
conditional_clues.pigs: Pigs can amplify certain viruses. But without testing, I cannot say more.

auntie_ama.name: Auntie Phuong
always_reveal: Have you smelled the air in Nalu? It smells like chemicals.
They are using the new 'Dragon Fire' spray for the rice bugs.
My cousin used it and got a headache for 3 days.
Also, the pigs are screaming at night. Very spooky.
red_herrings: Dragon Fire spray causes the sleeping sickness.

healer_marcus.name: Healer Somchai
healer_marcus.personality: Suspicious of government. Proud. Knows about early cases.
always_reveal: I saw the fever first. Before the hospital.
It is a hot fever. The body shakes.
It comes from the bad air near the water.
I gave herbs, but for some, the shaking did not stop.

conditional_clues.pigs: The pigs get the fever too. I have seen them stumble.
conditional_clues.mosquitoes: The biting flies are terrible this year.
conditional_clues.pesticide: It is not the poison. Poison makes you vomit and drool. This fever makes you stiff.

red_herrings: Suggests the mines poison the wind

mr_osei.name: Mr. Nguyen
mr_osei.personality: Practical. Focused on water, sanitation, and environment.
always_reveal: Rice paddy expansion led to more standing water.
I checked the water pumps - no bacterial contamination.
I see many animals near the homes. Pigs, chickens, ducks.
High mosquito burden near fields and pig farms.

conditional_clues.pesticide: I tested for organophosphates in the water. Levels are low. Not enough to cause mass seizures.
conditional_clues.toxin: I tested for organophosphates in the water. Levels are low. Not enough to cause mass seizures.
conditional_clues.mosquito counts: Evening mosquito counts are extremely high - Culex species mainly.

red_herrings: Mentions latrine overflow - irrelevant to encephalitis

teacher_grace.name: Teacher Ratana
teacher_grace.personality: Observant. Data-driven. Cooperative. Worried about school reputation.
always_reveal: Three sick children are my students.
Children from Kabwe walk to my school every day.
They walk along the canal path. It takes 40 minutes.
Mosquitoes are bad in the classrooms.

conditional_clues.vaccination: We have no record of encephalitis vaccines for the new students.
conditional_clues.pesticide: I smelled chemicals last week, but the children got sick on different days. It wasn't a single event.

red_herrings: Wonders whether the new school latrine project brought disease

mayor_simon.name: Mayor Budi
mayor_simon.personality: Worries about money and reputation. Downplays outbreaks.
always_reveal: He approved the rice paddy expansion project - it brings money!
He denied funding for mosquito control last budget cycle.
Streetlights near paddies broke months ago.

conditional_clues.pig cooperative: The Co-op is good for the economy! We keep the pigs there.
conditional_clues.pesticide: Dragon Fire? Never heard of it. My farmers use only approved chemicals.

red_herrings: Suggests school must be the source
